Name: Payment Gateway
Description: System facilitating online payment processing.
Business Logic: Verifies payment details and routes funds.

Name: Merchant Account
Description: Bank account allowing businesses to accept payments.
Business Logic: Holds funds received from customer payments.

Name: Payment Card
Description: Plastic card enabling purchases.
Business Logic: Contains account information for payment authorization.

Name: Transaction ID
Description: Unique identifier for each payment transaction.
Business Logic: Tracks payment through the processing cycle.

Name: Authorization Code
Description: Code returned by the issuer confirming payment approval.
Business Logic: Indicates the transaction is authorized.

Name: Settlement Date
Description: Date funds are transferred to the merchant account.
Business Logic: Date of actual money transfer.

Name: Chargeback
Description: Disputed transaction reversed by the issuer.
Business Logic: Customer disputes the transaction with their bank.

Name: Refund
Description: Return of funds to the customer.
Business Logic: Merchant returns money to the customer.

Name: AVS
Description: Address Verification System
Business Logic: Verifies the billing address provided by the customer.

Name: CVV
Description: Card Verification Value
Business Logic: 3 or 4-digit security code on the card.

Name: PCI DSS
Description: Payment Card Industry Data Security Standard
Business Logic: Security standards for handling cardholder data.

Name: Tokenization
Description: Replacing sensitive data with a non-sensitive equivalent.
Business Logic: Protects cardholder data during transmission and storage.

Name: 3D Secure
Description: Authentication protocol for online transactions.
Business Logic: Adds an extra layer of security for online payments.

Name: EMV Chip
Description: Microchip embedded in payment cards.
Business Logic: Enhanced security compared to magnetic stripe.

Name: Contactless Payment
Description: Payment made by tapping a card or device.
Business Logic: Convenient payment method using near-field communication.

Name: Recurring Payment
Description: Automated payment scheduled at regular intervals.
Business Logic: Customers authorize recurring charges for goods or services.

Name: Payment Schedule
Description: Defines the dates and amounts for recurring payments.
Business Logic: Outlines the payment arrangement.

Name: Invoice
Description: Request for payment for goods or services.
Business Logic: Sent to the customer outlining charges.

Name: Payment Method
Description: Way a customer chooses to pay.
Business Logic: Options like credit card, debit card, bank transfer, etc.

Name: Gateway Fees
Description: Charges assessed by the payment gateway.
Business Logic: Costs associated with processing payments.

Name: Interchange Fees
Description: Fees paid to the card-issuing bank.
Business Logic: Bank's cost for each card transaction.

Name: Payout
Description: Funds transferred to the merchant.
Business Logic: Money sent to the merchant's account.

Name: Currency Code
Description: Standard three-letter code representing a currency.
Business Logic: e.g., USD, EUR, GBP

Name: Bank Account Number
Description: Unique identifier for a bank account.
Business Logic: Used for ACH transfers and other banking transactions.

Name: Routing Number
Description: Nine-digit code identifying a financial institution.
Business Logic: Used for ACH transfers and wire transfers.

Name: ACH Transfer
Description: Electronic transfer of funds between bank accounts.
Business Logic: Common method for direct deposit and bill payments.

Name: Wire Transfer
Description: Electronic transfer of funds between banks.
Business Logic: Typically used for international transactions.

Name: Fraud Detection
Description: Identifying and preventing fraudulent transactions.
Business Logic: Systems that flag suspicious activity.

Name: Risk Management
Description: Assessing and mitigating payment-related risks.
Business Logic: Strategies to protect against fraud and other losses.

Name: Chargeback Ratio
Description: Percentage of transactions resulting in chargebacks.
Business Logic: Indicator of potential fraud or service issues.

Name: Merchant Category Code (MCC)
Description: Four-digit code classifying a merchant's business.
Business Logic: Used by card networks to categorize merchants.

Name: Terminal
Description: Device used to process card payments in a physical store.
Business Logic: Point-of-sale device.

Name: Batch Settlement
Description: Grouping of transactions for settlement.
Business Logic: Process of settling multiple transactions at once.

Name: Payment Request
Description: Initiation of a payment transaction.
Business Logic: Asking the customer to make a payment.

Name: Payment Confirmation
Description: Notification that a payment has been successfully processed.
Business Logic: Confirms the transaction was completed.

Name: Partial Authorization
Description: Authorization for a portion of the transaction amount.
Business Logic: When the full amount cannot be authorized.

Name: Voice Authorization
Description: Requesting authorization over the phone.
Business Logic: Used when electronic authorization is not possible.

Name: Card Brand
Description: Name of the payment card network.
Business Logic: Visa, Mastercard, American Express, Discover

Name: Card Issuer
Description: Bank that issued the payment card.
Business Logic: Bank associated with the card.

Name: Payment Network
Description: Infrastructure for processing payments.
Business Logic: Visa, Mastercard, etc.

Name: Settlement Account
Description: Bank account where funds are deposited after settlement.
Business Logic: Where the merchant receives payments.

Name: Reserve Account
Description: Account held by the payment processor to cover potential losses.
Business Logic: Funds held to cover chargebacks or other liabilities.

Name: Daily Limit
Description: Maximum amount that can be processed in a day.
Business Logic: Restriction on daily processing volume.

Name: Transaction Limit
Description: Maximum amount allowed per transaction.
Business Logic: Restriction on individual transaction size.

Name: Velocity Check
Description: Fraud prevention measure analyzing transaction speed and frequency.
Business Logic: Flags suspicious activity based on transaction patterns.

Name: BIN Number
Description: Bank Identification Number
Business Logic: First 6-8 digits of a payment card number.

Name: Address Line 1
Description: Street address for billing or shipping.
Business Logic: Primary address line.

Name: Address Line 2
Description: Apartment, suite, or unit number.
Business Logic: Secondary address line.

Name: City
Description: City for billing or shipping.
Business Logic: Location of the address.

Name: State
Description: State or province for billing or shipping.
Business Logic: Geographic region of the address.

Name: Zip Code
Description: Postal code for billing or shipping.
Business Logic: Numeric code for address.

Name: Country
Description: Country for billing or shipping.
Business Logic: Location of the address.

Name: Customer ID
Description: Unique identifier for a customer.
Business Logic: Used to track customer activity and preferences.

Name: Email Address
Description: Customer's email address.
Business Logic: Used for communication and notifications.

Name: Phone Number
Description: Customer's phone number.
Business Logic: Used for communication and verification.

Name: Device ID
Description: Unique identifier for the device used to make a payment.
Business Logic: Used for fraud detection and security.

Name: IP Address
Description: Internet Protocol address of the device used to make a payment.
Business Logic: Used for fraud detection and location tracking.

Name: Geolocation
Description: Geographic location of the device used to make a payment.
Business Logic: Used for fraud detection and targeted advertising.

Name: User Agent
Description: Information about the browser and operating system used to make a payment.
Business Logic: Used for fraud detection and website optimization.

Name: Time Zone
Description: Time zone of the customer.
Business Logic: Facilitates proper scheduling and logging of transactions.

Name: Order ID
Description: Unique identifier for an order.
Business Logic: Used to track orders and link them to payments.

Name: Shipping Address
Description: Address where the order is shipped.
Business Logic: Location for order delivery.

Name: Billing Address
Description: Address associated with the payment card.
Business Logic: Address used for billing statements.

Name: Item Price
Description: Price of a single item in an order.
Business Logic: Cost per item.

Name: Quantity
Description: Number of items in an order.
Business Logic: Number of units.

Name: Total Amount
Description: Total amount of the order.
Business Logic: Sum of all item prices and shipping costs.

Name: Shipping Cost
Description: Cost of shipping the order.
Business Logic: Charges for shipping.

Name: Tax Amount
Description: Amount of tax charged on the order.
Business Logic: Tax levied on the sale.

Name: Discount Amount
Description: Amount of discount applied to the order.
Business Logic: Reduction in price.

Name: Currency Symbol
Description: Symbol representing the currency.

Name: Locale
Description: Geographic region and language.
Business Logic: Used for formatting currency and dates.

Name: Payment Status
Description: Status of the payment.
Business Logic: Indicates whether the payment was successful, failed, or pending.

Name: Reason Code
Description: Code indicating the reason for a payment failure.
Business Logic: Provides information about why a payment failed.

Name: Response Code
Description: Code returned by the payment gateway indicating the status of the transaction.
Business Logic: Status indicator.

Name: Settlement Currency
Description: Currency in which the merchant receives payment.
Business Logic: Currency for funds transfer.

Name: Exchange Rate
Description: Rate used to convert one currency to another.
Business Logic: Used for cross-border transactions.

Name: Reconciliation
Description: Matching payments to orders and invoices.
Business Logic: Ensuring all transactions are accounted for.

Name: Batch ID
Description: Unique identifier for a batch of transactions.
Business Logic: Used for settlement and reporting.

Name: Merchant ID
Description: Unique identifier for a merchant.
Business Logic: Used by payment processors and banks to identify merchants.

Name: Acquirer
Description: Financial institution that processes payments on behalf of merchants.
Business Logic: The bank that receives funds from the customer's bank.

Name: Issuer
Description: Financial institution that issued the payment card.
Business Logic: The bank that provides credit or debit cards to customers.

Name: Card Expiry Date
Description: Date the payment card expires.
Business Logic: MM/YY format.

Name: Cardholder Name
Description: Name of the person who owns the payment card.
Business Logic: As it appears on the card.

Name: Payment Description
Description: Description of the payment.
Business Logic: Used for record-keeping and customer statements.

Name: Refund ID
Description: Unique identifier for a refund transaction.
Business Logic: Used to track refunds.

Name: Original Transaction ID
Description: Transaction ID of the original payment.
Business Logic: Used to link refunds to the original payment.

Name: Dispute Amount
Description: Amount of money in dispute.
Business Logic: The amount the customer is contesting.

Name: Dispute Reason
Description: Reason for the dispute.
Business Logic: Explanation for the dispute.

Name: Dispute Resolution
Description: Outcome of the dispute.
Business Logic: Resolved, Lost, Won

Name: Statement Descriptor
Description: Description that appears on the customer's credit card statement.
Business Logic: Should be recognizable to the customer.

Name: Dynamic Currency Conversion (DCC)
Description: Offering the customer the option to pay in their home currency.
Business Logic: Conversion at the point of sale.

Name: Installment Payment
Description: Payment plan where the total amount is divided into smaller, regular payments.
Business Logic: Structured payment agreement

Name: Minimum Payment
Description: The smallest amount a customer can pay on their credit card bill.
Business Logic: Required monthly payment

Name: Credit Limit
Description: The maximum amount a customer can charge on their credit card.
Business Logic: Card's upper spending bound

Name: Available Credit
Description: The amount of credit a customer has available on their credit card.
Business Logic: Spendable balance

Name: Interest Rate
Description: The percentage charged on outstanding credit card balances.
Business Logic: Annual Percentage Rate

Name: Cashback Reward
Description: A percentage of purchases returned to the customer as a reward.
Business Logic: Card loyalty benefits

Name: Point-of-Sale (POS)
Description: The location where a transaction occurs, usually a retail store.
Business Logic: Transactional Venue

Name: Card Present Transaction
Description: A transaction where the physical card is used at the point of sale.
Business Logic: Card swiped or inserted into reader

Name: Card Not Present Transaction
Description: A transaction where the physical card is not used, such as online or over the phone.
Business Logic: Online purchase
